In forensic science, which of the following is a primary use of gas chromatography?
A. To identify the cause of death
B. To determine the time of death
C. To separate and analyze compounds in a substance
D. To identify fingerprints

In forensic science, gas chromatography is primarily used for option C: to separate and analyze compounds in a substance. This technique is invaluable for identifying and quantifying volatile and semi-volatile organic compounds, such as drugs, toxins, and accelerants, which can be crucial evidence in criminal investigations.
